comments.body: @Pterosaur This is just temporary solution here to make things going on sonic buildimage, since you designed this, it would be best if you will handle proper fix for that.

please fix compilation issues:
 ../../lib/inc/sai_redis.h:73:32: error: 'SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_FINE_GRAINED_HASH' was not declared in this scope
compile locally before submitting 
object type is called "FINE_GRAINED_HASH_FIELD"

It looks like the same set of tests are failing consistently and all of them seem to be related to next hop groups.

I took a look at the logs from one of the failures (https://sonic-jenkins.westus2.cloudapp.azure.com/job/vs/job/sonic-sairedis-build-pr/845/artifact/swss/tests/log/test_acl_portchannel/log/) and found this:

```
Dec 17 13:55:20.029414 3ea5d8b82340 NOTICE #orchagent: :- addNextHopGroup: Create next hop group 40.0.0.1@PortChannel001,40.0.0.3@PortChannel002,40.0.0.5@PortChannel003,40.0.0.7@PortChannel004
Dec 17 13:55:20.029444 3ea5d8b82340 ERR #orchagent: :- bulkCreate: mode vlaue 0 is not in range on sai_stats_mode_t
Dec 17 13:55:20.029451 3ea5d8b82340 ERR #orchagent: :- addNextHopGroup: Failed to create next hop group 50000000005e8 member 0: 0
```

I see similar messages for the other tests that are failing as well.

there is a bug in metadata where sai_metadata_enum_sai_stats_mode_t is used instead of sai_metadata_enum_sai_bulk_op_error_mode_t, and i will fix that, but coincidently, value 0 is in both of those, that is interesting fail :D this is interesting, since this was working with bulk operations from 201811 branch to master which i recently checked with @shi-su and no issues on that mode
this ```bulkCreate: mode vlaue 0 is not in range on sai_stats_mode_t``` it's like medatada was corrupted really strange, if you have a consistent repro on that it would be good to put some more logs in case where this happens

fixing here: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/753, but it can produce same error as above, but i dont have idea why
this will also needs to be handled by sonic syslog rotate, since how it's hardcoded to sairedis.rec i think

> this will also needs to be handled by sonic syslog rotate, since how it's hardcoded to sairedis.rec i think

Yes, I will create a PR in sonic-buildimage for logrotate
can you check the lgtm failure?

relates to Winline warning and recent changes to swss-common
im disabling it since it's not critical https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/741

latestReviews.body: Please also check with other reviewers.

reviews.body: Do you know if there are any other places that use the sync mode option? I know it is used in `syncd_init_common.sh` start syncd in sync mode. If you know any other places that use it, probably we need to note it somewhere so that it would be easier to update all of them to communication mode.
Please also check with other reviewers.

Hi @kcudnik, Just wonder that ZMQ needs sync mode to be enabled, since in common understanding, sync mode will take performance down. Will appreciate if share some cases that turning on ZMQ could help the performance, Thanks a lot.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17052279/127145236-9efb91fe-7516-45a6-9ea5-ac8c65006136.png)
take a look at performance test made on VS switch, 10k, 50k and 100k are number of routes not using bulk api

and here are using bulk mode: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17052279/127145579-503b6602-878a-4cbf-a8fb-093465c79ef5.png)
you are interested in player time, like OA would call it
also those stats are from Jan 2021 and code since then was improved so it's even faster, we currently have over 10k routes per second

> also those stats are from Jan 2021 and code since then was improved so it's even faster, we currently have over 10k routes per second

Thanks Kcudnik. 
In above sheet, seems the bulk mode approximate rate is 3k per second end to end. But currently it can be up to 10k? Are there any other enhancements in SONiC for this?

yes, we would need to run new test to get current numbers 
just make some tests: on zmq/sync, 100k routes in 2 configurations 100 per bulk x 1000, and 1000 per bulk x 100:
```
$ time $PL -u -z zmq_sync 1000_100
real    0m6,036s
user    0m2,941s
sys     0m0,071s
$ time $PL -u -z zmq_sync 100_1000
real    0m5,756s
user    0m2,876s
sys     0m0,101s

from logs:
ltsyncd          : inc: 10000 (calls 100) Syncd::syncUpdateRedisBulkQuadEvent op took: 240 ms
ltsyncd          : inc: 10000 (calls 100) Syncd::processBulkCreateEntry(route_entry) CREATE op took: 95 ms
ltsaiplayer       : inc: 10000 (calls 100) RedisRemoteSaiInterface::bulkCreate(route_entry) op took: 389 ms
ltsaiplayer       : inc: 10000 (calls 100) SaiPlayer::handle_bulk_entry::bulkCreate("route_entry") op took: 467 ms
```
so performance is ~16k/sec (entire process) and over ~20k if we measure on the bulk api call itself, but this is on my dev device, on physical switch will be slower since those devices tend to have slower cpus
yes, it's big improvement. What's the differences between the sheet test and the ~16k/sec test? the new enhancement code or the test dev device?
difference is running in January vs July, code improvements and dev machine vs local dev laptop, also -O2 flag
Hi Kcudnik, On current env, do you have async mode performance number? that would be helpful. Thanks a lot.

for async mode:
```
$ time $PL -u -z redis_async 1000_100

user    0m2,596s
sys     0m0,070s

$ time $PL -u -z redis_async 100_1000
real    0m2,953s
user    0m2,450s
sys     0m0,059s
```

Also since you are adding bulk support, an unittests would be appreciated:
* for this it would be be best to make this bulk support flag as commandline option, then you can easy support that in unittest
* virtual switch will need to be updated to support bulk API
* saiplayer will also need to be updated to support bulk API

I just checked Meta.cpp, those bulk* apis there are only for explicit apis, so if you want to add bulk* with meta_key, then you will need also implement all meta check there as well THIS IS REQUIREMENT

> Also since you are adding bulk support, an unittests would be appreciated:
> 
> * for this it would be be best to make this bulk support flag as commandline option, then you can easy support that in unittest
> * virtual switch will need to be updated to support bulk API
> * saiplayer will also need to be updated to support bulk API

done, please review whole pr
Could you explain this more ? i dont understand this issue here
can we have some kinds of unit test for this?

> @abdosi when switch is created, there is discovery logic that discovers all the oids, it does not matter whether its cold or warm boot
> so at new instance 3.7 SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_DEFAULT_STP_INST_ID will be discovered, as it was not present on 3.5
> and this should be done in different way, SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_DEFAULT_STP_INST_ID should be added to m_default_rid_map in SaiSwitch.cpp, and then when function isSwitchObjectDefaultRid() inside isNonRemovableRid(), and isNonRemovableRid is called in ComparisonLogic, then that object will not be removed, since that is default object

@kcudnik : Thanks looks like logic is different in master vs 201911. I will rework this PR for 201911 branch. Master looks fine.

Ok, so master works fine without any issues? just 201911 is affected?

as for unittests, this will be tricky to implement in current test mechanism, since it would require to have 2 different version of syncd (compiled with version A and then B) and cold boot from A to warm boot to B, or to have a new special configuration file for virtual switch that on warm boot it could be specified to "enable" new STP object to be existing on the VS

> Ok, so master works fine without any issues? just 201911 is affected?
> 
I revisited the code-path you mention and issue will be present both in master and 201911. I am verifying on 201911 as of now. Here are two issue in above approach -

Issue 1: 

In Function isNonRemovableRid() we first check for isColdBootDiscoveredRid() and then isSwitchObjectDefaultRid(). In This particular case DefaultRid was dicovered as part of Warm-boot so first check will fail and return. 
I think the order should be reverse.  Let me know.


Issue 2:
Even after we reverse the order (as mention in Issue 1 above ) the API ComparisonLogic::checkMap() will fail. This is because since this discovered Switch Internal OID never gets updated to tempView.

I think my initial change where I add Internal OID to COLDVIDS (irrespective of Cold or Warm boot)  make it clean because then populateExisting Object logic will take care of adding this to temp view with the existing logic.

> as for unittests, this will be tricky to implement in current test mechanism, since it would require to have 2 different version of syncd (compiled with version A and then B) and cold boot from A to warm boot to B, or to have a new special configuration file for virtual switch that on warm boot it could be specified to "enable" new STP object to be existing on the VS
@kcudnik can you check my comments above
ok, thats sounds good, just put a those comments in that change why we populate those tables in redis

@kcudnik 
When DEBUG was enabled, syncd was crashing in 32-bit CPU because of the format specifier. Fixed it. Pls review.

Hi @kcudnik, @lguohan 
Can you merge it? We need it for ACS-MSN4700 RPC image.
Thanks.
can you list the commit id picked by this pr?
just wondering if such check for getlink should be also added when creating tap interfaces ?

> just wondering if such check for getlink should be also added when creating tap interfaces ?

The check is already present during create hostif. However it was not added during remove which might cause problems.

Fix looks good from my end. What I did was:
1. Download the latest docker-sonic-vs from [here](https://sonic-jenkins.westus2.cloudapp.azure.com/job/vs/job/buildimage-vs-all/341/artifact/target/).
2. Ran the ACL and VLAN tests. Everything passed as expected.
3. I then installed all the debs from the initial gearbox PR [here](https://sonic-jenkins.westus2.cloudapp.azure.com/job/vs/job/sonic-sairedis-build-pr/507/artifact/target/).
4. Ran the ACL and VLAN tests. The tests failed with the same symptoms I described in the revert PR.
5. I installed all the debs from this PR with the fix [here](https://sonic-jenkins.westus2.cloudapp.azure.com/job/vs/job/sonic-sairedis-build-pr/514/artifact/target/).
6. Ran the ACL and VLAN tests. The tests all passed as expected.

I'm running the rest of the testbed now to confirm there aren't any more surprises, but so far so good. :rocket:

Thanks for all the help @daall appreciate the extra effort to help test this over the weekend.

@kcudnik - only difference between this pull request and merge reverted is commit 8b2d815befcd50c4e925d1a52ead3f7a5852d3f0 - could you please review that part of this change and approve/merge? Sorry for the inconvenience, and thanks.
@kcudnik review request, as discussed in e-mail
lgtm, @kcudnik, please merge if you are ok with it.
@kcudnik  and @lguohan thanks for the careful reviews, approval, merge.

If only purpose of -p is to get a context config variable, then if -p specified, the profile.ini parser should look for missing SAI_REDIS_CONTEXT_CONFIG=<path>. If missing, should be logged as ERROR or EXIT, or maybe throw an exception. 

Also, not sure we need -p if we have -x, but ok to have both as long as above check is supporting reason for profile.ini in first place.

if -p and -x specified, and both have different context config path, which is used? Should we warn user that one shadows the other? Or maybe, is an error if both -x and -p are used? I know, maybe getting too nit-picky here, but debugging test scripts can be difficult as we have seen, so this might help someone who is seeing saiplayer errors to diagnose what is going wrong.

> If only purpose of -p is to get a context config variable, then if -p specified, the profile.ini parser should look for missing SAI_REDIS_CONTEXT_CONFIG=. If missing, should be logged as ERROR or EXIT, or maybe throw an exception.
> 
> Also, not sure we need -p if we have -x, but ok to have both as long as above check is supporting reason for profile.ini in first place.

missing SAI_REDIS_CONTEXT_CONFIG is not error, since other entries could be used, by default there is only one default context

> if -p and -x specified, and both have different context config path, which is used? Should we warn user that one shadows the other?

-x will overrride profile.ini, i just added this for convenience

> add warning here if key SAI_REDIS_KEY_CONTEXT_CONFIG already present in m_profileMap

Hey, i added that message
These patches work, please merge them, work I am doing for sonic-sairedis to support gearbox phy tests are dependent on them.
